event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Increment PMSWINC Register
event.description: The counter increments on writes to the PMSWINC register.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Load
event.description: The counter increments for every executed memory-reading instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Store
event.description: The counter increments for every executed memory-writing instruction. DC ZVA is counted as a store. The counter does not increment for a Store-Exclusive instruction that fails.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter increments for every architecturally executed instruction.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Taken
event.description: The counter increments for each exception taken.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Exception Returns
event.description: The counter increments for each executed exception return instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to CONTEXTIDR
event.description: The counter increments for every write to the CONTEXTIDR.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to PC
event.description: The counter increments for every software change of the PC. This includes all: Branch instructions, memory reading instructions that explicitly write to the PC, Data processing instructions that explicitly write to the PC, and Exception return instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Immediate)
event.description: The counter counts all immediate branch instructions that are architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return)
event.description: The counter counts all procedure return instructions that are architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Unaligned Load/Store
event.description: The counter counts each memory-reading instruction or memory-writing instruction access that would generate an Alignment fault when Alignment fault checking is enabled.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to TTBR
event.description: The counter counts writes to the translation table base registers, TTBR0 and TTBR1.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Any)
event.description: The counter counts all branches on the architecturally executed path that would incur cost if mispredicted.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access' that causes a demand refill of any of the Level 1 caches outside the Level 1 caches of this PE. A refill includes any access that causes data to be fetched from outside the cache, even if the data is ultimately not allocated into the cache. For example, data might be fetched into a buffer but then discarded, rather than being allocated into a cache. These buffers are treated as part of the cache. If the cache is shared, only events attributable to this PE are counted. If the cache is not shared, all events are counted.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts attributable instruction memory accesses that cause a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 instruction TLB. This includes each Instruction memory access that causes an access to a level of memory system due to a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that causes a demand refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified cache from outside the Level 1 cache. Each access to a cache line that causes a new linefill is counted, including those from instructions that generate multiple accesses, such as load or store multiples, and PUSH and POP instructions. In particular, the counter counts accesses to the Level 1 cache that cause a refill that is satisfied by another Level 1 data or unified cache, or a Level 2 cache, or memory. A refill includes any access that causes data to be fetched from outside the cache, even if the data is ultimately not allocated into the cache. For example, data might be fetched into a buffer but then discarded, rather than being allocated into a cache. These buffers are treated as part of the cache.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each memory read operation or memory write operation that causes a cache access to at least the Level 1 data or unified cache. If the cache is shared, only events attributable to this PE are counted. If the cache is not shared, all events are counted. Each access to a cache line is counted including the multiple accesses of instructions, such as LDM or STM . Each access to other Level 1 data or unified memory structures, for example refill buffers, write buffers, and write-back buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each attributable memory read operation or attributable memory write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified TLB. It counts each read or write that causes a refill, in the form of a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Mispredictions
event.description: The counter counts each correction to the predicted program flow that occurs because of a misprediction from, or no prediction from, a change in control flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Cycles
event.name: CPU Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Possible Predictions
event.description: The counter counts every branch or other change in the program flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts memory read operations and memory write operations that the PE made. The counter increments whether the access results in an access to a Level 1 data or unified cache, a Level 2 data or unified cache, or neither of these.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts attributable instruction memory accesses that access at least the Level 1 instruction or unified cache. Each access to other Level 1 instruction memory structures, such as refill buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: The counter counts every write-back of data from the Level 1 data or unified cache. The counter counts each write-back that causes data to be written from the Level 1 cache to outside of the Level 1 cache.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts memory read operations and memory write operations that access outside of the boundary of the PE and its closely-coupled caches. Where this boundary lies with respect to any implemented caches is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.

event.title: Errors
event.name: Memory
event.description: The counter counts every occurrence of a memory error signaled by a memory closely coupled to this PE. The definition of local memories is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED but includes caches, tightly-coupled memories, and TLB arrays.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter counts instructions that are speculatively executed by the PE. This includes instructions that are subsequently not architecturally executed.

event.title: Cycles
event.name: Bus Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle of the interface at the boundary of the PE and its closely-coupled caches. Where this boundary lies with respect to any implemented caches is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Allocation without refill
event.description: The counter increments on every attributable write that writes an entire line into the Level 1 cache without fetching from outside the Level 1 cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Allocation without refill
event.description: The counter increments on every attributable write that writes an entire line into the Level 2 cache without fetching from outside the Level 1 or Level 2 caches

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Mispredicted)
event.description: The counter counts all instructions counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Any)' that were not correctly predicted.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend
event.description: The counter counts every cycle counted by the 'Cycles: CPU Cycles' event on which no operation was issued because there are no operations available to issue for this PE from the frontend.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend
event.description: The counter counts every cycle counted by the 'Cycles: CPU Cycles' event on which no operation was issued because either: The backend is unable to accept any of the operations available for issue for this PE, OR the backend is unable to accept any operations.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each attributable memory read operation or attributable memory write operation that causes a TLB access to at least the Level 1 data or unified TLB. Each access to a TLB record is counted including the multiple accesses of instructions, such as LDM or STM.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each attributable Instruction memory access that causes a TLB access to at least the Level 1 instruction or unified TLB.

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each attributable memory read operation or attributable memory write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the Level 2 data or unified TLB. It counts each attributable read or attributable write that causes a refill, in the form of a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each attributable memory read operation or attributable memory write operation that causes a TLB access to at least the Level 2 data or unified TLB. Each access to a TLB record is counted, including the multiple accesses of instructions such as LDM or STM.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'Last Level Cache: Access', but counts only memory read accesses.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Miss (due to read)
event.description: As 'Last Level Cache: Miss', but counts only memory read operations.

event.title: Multi-socket Remote Access
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'Multi-socket Remote Access: Access', but counts only memory read operations.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (due to long-latency read)
event.description: The counter counts each memory read access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that incurs additional latency because it returns data from outside the Level 1 data or unified cache of this processing element. The event indicates to software that the access missed in the Level 1 data or unified cache and might have a significant performance impact compared to the latency of an access that hits in the Level 1 data or unified cache.

event.title: Operations
event.name: Executed
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Operations: Speculated' that would be executed in a Simple sequential execution of the program.

event.title: Operations
event.name: Speculated
event.description: The counter counts the number of operations executed by the PE, including those that are executed speculatively and would not be executed in a Simple sequential execution of the program.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: All
event.description: The counter counts every attributable cycle on which no attributable instruction or operation was sent for execution on this processing element.

event.title: Stalls (Slots)
event.name: Frontend
event.description: Counts each Slot counted by 'Stalls (Slots): All' where no attributable instruction or operation was sent for execution because the backend is unable to accept it

event.title: Stalls (Slots)
event.name: Backend
event.description: Counts each Slot counted by 'Stalls (Slots): All' where no attributable instruction or operation was sent for execution because there was no attributable instruction or operation available to issue from the PE from the frontend for the Slot

event.title: Stalls (Slots)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter counts on each attributable cycle the number of instruction or operation Slots that were not occupied by an instruction or operation attributable to the processing element.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Miss (due to long-latency read)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access' that incurs additional latency because it returns instructions from outside the Level 1 instruction cache. The event indicates to software that the access missed in the Level 1 instruction cache and might have a significant performance impact due to the additional latency, compared to the latency of an access that hits in the Level 1 instruction cache.

event.title: Latency
event.name: Access with additional latency from alignment
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'Memory: Access' that, due to the alignment of the address and size of data being accessed, incurred additional latency.

event.title: Latency
event.name: Load with additional latency from alignment
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read access counted by 'Latency: Access with additional latency from alignment'.

event.title: Latency
event.name: Store with additional latency from alignment
event.description: The counter counts each memory-write access counted by 'Latency: Access with additional latency from alignment'.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to prefetch)
event.description: Level 2 cache refill due to prefetch.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to prefetch)
event.description: Level 1 data cache refill due to prefetch.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 2 cache write streaming mode.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Enter Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 1 data cache entering write streaming mode.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 1 data cache write streaming mode.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Conditional)
event.description: Conditional branch that is executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Indirect, Mispredicted)
event.description: Indirect branch that is mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Indirect, Mispredicted Address)
event.description: Indirect branch that is mispredicted because of address mis-compare.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Conditional, Mispredicted)
event.description: Conditional branch mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Indirect, Address predicted)
event.description: Indirect branch with predicted address executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return, Address predicted)
event.description: Procedure return with predicted address executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return, Mispredicted Address)
event.description: Procedure return mispredicted due to address mis-compare.

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Access (Last Level Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB last-level walk cache access.

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Refill (Last Level Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB last-level walk cache refill.

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Access (Level 2 Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB level-2 walk cache access.

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Refill (Level 2 Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB level-2 walk cache refill.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Cache miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the frontend, cache miss.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (TLB miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the frontend, TLB miss.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend interlock.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, AGU)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, interlock, AGU.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, FPU)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, interlock, FPU.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Load)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, load.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Store)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, store.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Load, Cache-miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, load, cache miss.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Load, TLB-miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, load, TLB miss.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Store, STB full)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, store, STB full.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Store, TLB-miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, store, TLB miss.

event.title: Stalls (Aliasing Table)
event.name: Backend Hit (Load)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, load, hit in check aliasing table.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Immediate Branch)
event.name: Access
event.description: Fetch pipeline accessed nano predictors for an immediate branch.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Immediate Branch)
event.name: Hit
event.description: An immediate branch hit in the nano predictors in the fetch pipeline

event.title: Nano Predictors (Immediate Branch)
event.name: Mis-predict
event.description: An immediate branch mis-predicted in the nano predictors in the fetch pipeline.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Conditional Branch)
event.name: Access
event.description: Fetch pipeline accessed nano predictors for a conditional branch.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Conditional Branch)
event.name: Hit
event.description: A conditional branch hit in the nano predictors in the fetch pipeline.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Conditional Branch)
event.name: Mid-predict
event.description: A conditional branch mis-predicted in the nano predictors in the fetch pipeline.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Indirect Branch)
event.name: Access
event.description: Fetch pipeline accessed nano predictors for an indirect branch.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Indirect Branch)
event.name: Hit
event.description: An indirect branch hit in the nano predictors in the fetch pipeline.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Indirect Branch)
event.name: Mis-predict
event.description: An indirect branch mis-predicted in the nano predictors in the fetch pipeline.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Return Instruction)
event.name: Access
event.description: Fetch pipeline accessed nano predictors for a return instruction.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Return Instruction)
event.name: Hit
event.description: A return instruction hit in the nano predictors in the fetch pipeline.

event.title: Nano Predictors (Return Instruction)
event.name: Mis-predict
event.description: A return instruction mis-predicted in the nano predictors in the fetch pipeline.

event.title: System Cache (Interconnect cache, Inter-cluster peer)
event.name: Access (Read)
event.description: This event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of interconnect cache or inter-cluster peer.

event.title: System Cache (DRAM)
event.name: Access (Read)
event.description: This event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of DRAM.

event.title: LLPP
event.name: Access (Read)
event.description: LLPP access, read, counts for every unique read request sent to the LLPP read address channel.

event.title: LLPP
event.name: Access (Write)
event.description: LLPP access, write, counts for every unique write request sent to the LLPP write address channel.

event.title: LLPP
event.name: Access
event.description: Counts accesses made on the LLPP. This event is a sum of LLPP_ACCESS_WR and LLPP_ACCESS_RD.

event.title: Main Manager
event.name: Access (Read)
event.description: Main manager access, read, counts for every unique read request sent to the main read data channel between the core and the L2.

event.title: Main Manager
event.name: Access (Write)
event.description: Main manager access, write, counts for every unique write request sent to the main write data channel between the core and the L2.

event.title: Main Manager
event.name: Access
event.description: Counts accesses made on the main data channel between the core and the L2. This event is a sum of MM_ACCESS_WR and MM_ACCESS_RD.

event.title: LLRAM
event.name: Access (Read)
event.description: Low-latency RAM access, read, counts for every unique read request sent to the main data channel between the core and the LLRAM coherency unit targeting the LLRAM port.

event.title: LLRAM
event.name: Access (Write)
event.description: Low-latency RAM access, write, counts for every unique write request sent to the main data channel between the core and the LLRAM coherency unit targeting the LLRAM port.

event.title: LLRAM
event.name: Access
event.description: Counts accesses made between the core and the LLRAM coherency unit targeting the LLRAM port. This event is a sum of LLRAM_ACCESS_WR and LLRAM_ACCESS_RD.

event.title: SPP
event.name: Access (Read)
event.description: Shared peripheral port access, read, counts for every unique read request sent to the data channel between the core and the LLRAM coherency unit targeting the SPP port.

event.title: SPP
event.name: Access (Write)
event.description: Shared peripheral port access, write, counts for every unique write request sent to the data channel between the core and the LLRAM coherency unit targeting the SPP port.

event.title: SPP
event.name: Access
event.description: Counts accesses made between the core and the LLRAM coherency unit targeting the SPP port. This event is a sum of SPP_ACCESS_WR and SPP_ACCESS_RD.

event.title: TCMs
event.name: Access (Read)
event.description: ACELS access to TCMs, read, counts for every unique read request sent to the TCMs from the ACELS port to this core.

event.title: TCMs
event.name: Access (Write)
event.description: ACELS access to TCMs, write, counts for every unique write request sent to the TCMs from the ACELS port to this core.

event.title: TCMs
event.name: Access
event.description: Counts accesses made between the ACELS port and the core. This event is a sum of TCMS_ACCESS_WR and TCMS_ACCESS_RD.

event.title: Stalls (TCMs)
event.name: Contention
event.description: Counts every stall cycle due to contention of accessing ITCM and DTCM via the ACELS port at the same time.

event.title: Snoops (L2)
event.name: Access
event.description: Counts every unique snoop request received by the core from the L2. This includes snoops received from the own core, another core or from outside the cluster in the CHI configuration.

event.title: Snoops (LLRAM Coherency Unit)
event.name: Access
event.description: Counts every unique snoop request received by the core from the LLRAM coherency unit. This includes snoops received from the own core or another core.

event.title: Snoops
event.name: Access
event.description: Counts every unique snoop request received by the core. This event is a sum of MM_SNP_ACCESS and LLRAM_SNP_ACCESS.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache (MM Region)
event.name: Refill
event.description: Level 1 instruction cache refill for an address to the main manager region. Counts any instruction fetch which misses in the cache. Cache maintenance instructions are not counted. Non- cacheable accesses are not counted.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache (MM Port)
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 1 instruction cache access targeting the main manager port.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (MM Port)
event.name: Refill (Read)
event.description: Level 1 data cache refill, read from the main manager port.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (MM Port)
event.name: Refill (Write)
event.description: Level 1 data cache refill, write from the main manager port.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (MM Port)
event.name: Refill
event.description: Level 1 data cache refill for the main manager port. This event counts the sum of MM_L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD and MM_L1D_CACHE_REFILL_WR.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (MM Region)
event.name: Access (Read)
event.description: Level 1 data cache access, read targeting the main manager address region.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (MM Region)
event.name: Access (Write)
event.description: Level 1 data cache access, write targeting the main manager address region.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (MM Port)
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 1 data cache access targeting the main manager port. This event counts the sum of MM_L1D_CACHE_RD and MM_L1D_CACHE_WR.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache (LLRAM)
event.name: Refill
event.description: Level 1 instruction cache refill for an address to the LLRAM region. Counts any instruction fetch which misses in the cache. Cache maintenance instructions are not counted. Non-cacheable accesses are not counted.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache (LLRAM)
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 1 instruction cache access targeting the low-latency RAM region.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (LLRAM)
event.name: Refill (Read)
event.description: Level 1 data cache refill, read from the LLRAM port.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (LLRAM)
event.name: Refill (Write)
event.description: Level 1 data cache refill, write from the LLRAM port.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (LLRAM)
event.name: Refill
event.description: Level 1 data cache refill from the LLRAM port. This event counts the sum of LLRAM_L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD and LLRAM_L1D_CACHE_REFILL_WR.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (LLRAM)
event.name: Access (Read)
event.description: Level 1 data cache access, read targeting the LLRAM address region.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (LLRAM)
event.name: Access (Write)
event.description: Level 1 data cache access, write targeting the LLRAM address region.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (LLRAM)
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 1 data cache access targeting the LLRAM address region. This event counts the sum of LLRAM_L1D_CACHE_RD and LLRAM_L1D_CACHE_WR.

event.title: TCMs
event.name: Access (from Data Side for Read)
event.description: I or D TCM accessed from the data side for a read operation.

event.title: TCMs
event.name: Access (from Data Side for Write)
event.description: I or D TCM accessed from the data side for a write operation.

event.title: ITCM (Instruction Pipe)
event.name: Access
event.description: ITCM accessed from the instruction pipe.

event.title: Stalls (Router)
event.name: Contention
event.description: More than one router packet needs arbitrating introducing contention.

event.title: STB Slots (MM)
event.name: Full
event.description: Counts every time the main manager STB slots are full.

event.title: STB slots (LLRAM)
event.name: Full
event.description: Counts every time the LLRAM STB slots are full. This event also covers accesses to the SPP region.

event.title: STB slots (LLPP)
event.name: Full
event.description: Counts every time the LLPP STB slots are full.

event.title: STB Slots (TCMs)
event.name: Full
event.description: Counts every time the TC STB slots are full.

event.title: STB Slots (Barrier)
event.name: Full
event.description: Counts every time the barrier STB slots are full.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache (Way Tracker)
event.name: Hit
event.description: L1 Instruction cache way tracker hit.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (Way Tracker)
event.name: Hit (Read)
event.description: L1 Data cache way tracker hit for a read operation from the data cache.

event.title: L1 Data Cache (Way Tracker)
event.name: Hit (Write)
event.description: A lookup into the TLAC hit.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to VSCTLR_EL2
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, write to VSCTLR_EL2.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Data Full Barrier
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass for data full barrier instruction.

event.title: EL2
event.name: Entered (Excluding Reset)
event.description: Exception taken to EL2 (hyp mode entry), excluding reset.

event.title: Instruction Pipeline (LLRAM)
event.name: Access (Timed Out)
event.description: An event to indicate that the instruction pipeline has timed out on a access to the LLRAM region.

event.title: Instruction Pipeline (MM Region)
event.name: Access (Timed Out)
event.description: An event to indicate that the instruction pipeline has timed out on a access to the main manager region.

event.title: Load/Store Pipeline (LLRAM)
event.name: Access (Timed Out)
event.description: An event to indicate that the load/store pipeline has timed out on a access to the LLRAM region.

event.title: Load/Store Pipeline (MM Region)
event.name: Access (Timed Out)
event.description: An event to indicate that the load/store pipeline has timed out on a access to the main manager region.

event.title: Load/Store Pipeline (LLPP)
event.name: Access (Timed Out)
event.description: An event to indicate that the load/store pipeline has timed out on a access to the LLPP region.

event.title: Load/Store Pipeline (SPP)
event.name: Access (Timed Out)
event.description: An event to indicate that the load/store pipeline has timed out on a access to the SPP region.

event.title: L1 Data TLB (Prefetcher)
event.name: Refill
event.description: Level 1 TLB refill used by the data side prefetcher. Counts any refill of the data L1-TLB from the L2 TLB. This includes refills which result in a translation fault. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.

event.title: L1 Data TLB (Prefetcher)
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 1 TLB access by the data side prefetcher.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory read accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory write accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory read accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to write)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory write accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (from inside cluster)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory operations that generate refills satisfied by transfer from another cache inside of the immediate cluster.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (from outside cluster)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory operations that generate refills satisfied by transfer from another cache outside of the immediate cluster.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'L2 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory-read operations that access at least the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'Bus: Access', but counts only memory-read operations that access outside the boundary of the PE and its closely-coupled caches.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'Bus: Access', but counts only memory-write operations that access outside the boundary of the PE and its closely-coupled caches.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'Memory: Access', but the counter counts only memory-read operations that the PE made.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'Memory: Access', but the counter counts only memory-write operations that the PE made.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' event.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Store' event.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load/Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading and memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' and 'Instructions (Executed): Store' events.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Integer)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only integer data-processing instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Advanced SIMD)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only Advanced SIMD data-processing instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Floating-point)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only floating-point data-processing instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (software PC writes)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only software changes of the PC.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (immediate)
event.description: The counter counts immediate branch instructions speculatively executed.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (return)
event.description: The counter counts procedure return instructions speculatively executed.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (indirect)
event.description: The counter counts indirect branch instructions speculatively executed. This includes software change of the PC other than exception-generating instructions and immediate branch instructions.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: SVC
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are Supervisor Call exceptions.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: IRQ
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are IRQ or Virtual IRQ exceptions.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: FIQ
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are FIQ or Virtual FIQ exceptions.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: HVC
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions that are Hypervisor Call exceptions including both those taken locally and from non-secure EL1/PL1.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Trap (IRQ)
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions not taken locally that are IRQ exceptions.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Trap (FIQ)
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions not taken locally that are FIQ exceptions.
